sn3.21:1.2: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, and sat down to one side. The Blessed One then said to him:
sn3.21:1.3: “Great king, there are these four kinds of persons found existing in the world.
sn3.21:1.5: The one heading from darkness to darkness,
sn3.21:1.6: the one heading from darkness to light,
sn3.21:1.7: the one heading from light to darkness,
sn3.21:1.8: the one heading from light to light.
sn3.21:2.1: “And how, great king, is a person one heading from darkness to darkness?
sn3.21:2.2: Here some person has been reborn in a low family—a family of caṇḍālas, bamboo workers, hunters, cartwrights, or flower-scavengers—a poor family in which there is little food and drink and which subsists with difficulty, one where food and clothing are obtained with difficulty;
sn3.21:2.3: and he is ugly, unsightly, deformed, chronically ill—purblind or cripple-handed or lame or paralyzed. He is not one who gains food, drink, clothing, and vehicles; garlands, scents, and unguents; bedding, housing, and lighting.
sn3.21:2.4: He engages in misconduct of body, speech, and mind.
sn3.21:2.5: Having done so, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in the plane of misery, in a bad destination, in the nether world, in hell.
sn3.21:3.1: “Suppose, great king, a man would go from darkness to darkness, or from gloom to gloom, or from stain to stain:
sn3.21:3.2: this person, I say, is exactly similar.
sn3.21:3.3: It is in this way, great king, that a person is one heading from darkness to darkness.
sn3.21:4.1: “And how, great king, is a person one heading from darkness to light?
sn3.21:4.4: He engages in good conduct of body, speech, and mind.
sn3.21:4.5: Having done so, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.
sn3.21:5.1: “Suppose, great king, a man would climb from the ground on to a palanquin, or from a palanquin on to horseback, or from horseback to an elephant mount, or from an elephant mount to a mansion:
sn3.21:5.2: this person, I say, is exactly similar.
sn3.21:5.3: It is in this way, great king, that a person is one heading from darkness to light.
sn3.21:6.1: “And how, great king, is a person one heading from light to darkness?
sn3.21:6.2: Here some person has been reborn in a high family—an affluent khattiya family, an affluent brahmin family, or an affluent householder family—one which is rich, with great wealth and property, with abundant gold and silver, abundant treasures and commodities, abundant wealth and grain;
sn3.21:6.3: and he is handsome, attractive, graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion. He is one who gains food, drink, clothing, and vehicles; garlands, scents, and unguents; bedding, housing, and lighting.
sn3.21:6.4: He engages in misconduct of body, speech, and mind.
sn3.21:6.5: Having done so, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in the plane of misery, in a bad destination, in the nether world, in hell.
sn3.21:7.1: “Suppose, great king, a man would descend from a mansion to an elephant mount, or from an elephant mount to horseback, or from horseback to a palanquin, or from a palanquin to the ground, or from the ground to underground darkness:
sn3.21:7.2: this person, I say, is exactly similar.
sn3.21:7.3: It is in this way, great king, that a person is one heading from light to darkness.
sn3.21:8.1: “And how, great king, is a person one heading from light to light?
sn3.21:8.2: Here some person has been reborn in a high family … with abundant wealth and grain;
sn3.21:8.3: and he is handsome, attractive, graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion. He is one who gains food … and lighting.
sn3.21:8.4: He engages in good conduct of body, speech, and mind.
sn3.21:8.5: Having done so, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.
sn3.21:9.1: “Suppose, great king, a man would cross over from palanquin to palanquin, or from horseback to horseback, or from elephant mount to elephant mount, or from mansion to mansion:
sn3.21:9.2: this person, I say, is exactly similar.
sn3.21:9.3: It is in this way, great king, that a person is one heading from light to light.
sn3.21:9.4: “These, great king, are the four kinds of persons found existing in the world.
